alert.note: Alert for Arlington; Fairfax; Prince William (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 17 at 11:35PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern Virginia, including the following counties, Arlington, City of Alexandria, Fairfax and Prince William. * WHEN...Until 830 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1135 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Several river gauges have risen quickly in the past 2-3 hours and are rising to near flood stage. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Arlington... Alexandria... Dale City... Annandale... Springfield... Fort Hunt... Groveton... Huntington... Fort Belvoir... Woodbridge... Crystal City... Lake Ridge... Burke... Lincolnia... Lorton... Franconia... Hybla Valley... Newington... I395 and I495 Interchange... West Springfield... - Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
